headline.main: URUGUAY SHIPS MORE WOOL; Exports Increase 18,896 Bales for Eleven-Month Period.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7.--The State Department was informed today that Lieut. Commander Harold D. Grow, United States Naval Reserve officer jailed by the new Peruvian junta for court martial, has been ordered released from prison, and that Charles...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7.--The State Department was informed today that Lieut. Commander Harold D. Grow, United States Naval Reserve officer jailed by the new Peruvian junta for court martial, has been ordered released from prison, and that Charles Sutton, another United States citizen arrested by the military junta, also would be set free.
docs.abstract: Legation will withdraw from Peru; Cuba will take over its affairs

headline.main: 2 AMERICANS FREED BY PERUVIAN JUNTA; Charles Sutton and Commander Grow Must Stay to Face Court-Martial if Wanted. WASHINGTON IS GRATIFIED Uruguayan Legation Will Quit Lima Wednesday--Cuba to Take Over Its Affairs There.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8.--Unofficial reports have reached the White House that the resignation of Leland Harrison, Minister to Uruguay, is on its way to President Hoover. The White House is looking to the State Department for any official declaration on...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8.--Unofficial reports have reached the White House that the resignation of Leland Harrison, Minister to Uruguay, is on its way to President Hoover. The White House is looking to the State Department for any official declaration on Mr. Harrison's decision, as, ...

docs.abstract: Telegram to State Govs stresses tranquillity throughout nation

headline.main: REPORT OF REVOLT IS DENIED BY BRAZIL; Government Says Order and Tranquillity Prevail in All Parts of Nation. URUGUAY MUSTERS CAVALRY But Envoy in Washington Asserts Rumors Are Unfounded and Tells of Independence Fetes. Revolt Report Denied. Uruguay Reports Revolt. Washington Embassy Issues Denial.

headline.main: BANKERS OFFER LOAN TO BRACE ARGENTINA; National City and Boston House Subscribe 10 Per Cent of $36,810,000 Volunteered. IRIGOYEN IS CRITICALLY ILL Ex-President Has Pneumonia-- Reports of Executions Are Denied by Officials. British Banks Also Join. BANKERS OFFER LOAN TO BRACE ARGENTINA Reports of Executions Denied. Once Thought Near Death. Students Continue Demonstrations. Justo Now Commander-in-Chief.

headline.main: BRAZILIANS ADMIT PLANS FOR REVOLT; State of Rio Grande do Sul Said to Be Preparing to Lead War on President Luiz. SOUTHERERN PREFECTS MEET 40,000 Troops Are Reported to Be Available Already for March Against National Capital. Newspaper Charges Frauds. Prefects Unite for Action.

headline.main: OUSTED PRESIDENT LEAVES ARGENTINA; BRAZIL NEAR REVOLT; Irigoyen, With Doctor, Sister and Daughter, Boards Cruiser Under Guard. SHIP ANCH0RS OFF CAPITAL Buenos Aires Hears He May Go to Europe--Malbran Hinted as Envoy Here.
